name: Henry M. Gunn High School
description: Joined the Gunn Robotics Team (FIRST Robotics team 192) in 2018. Worked on and eventually led the drivetrain subgroup, which was responsible for making the swerve drivetrain for the 2019 and 2020 FRC seasons. In my free time, I worked on developing a prototype differential swerve, which can be found in the projects section!

name: UC Santa Barbara
position: Double Major in Mechanical Engineering and Statistics and Data Science
description: Started as a mechanical engineering major, but realized my strengths were better suited in statistics and data science or computer science and took more courses in that realm. I also joined Gaucho Racing, UCSB's Formula SAE Electric team, working on the suspension, braking, and steering subteam.
favoriteCourses: ME 10 - Engineering Graphics: Sketching, CAD and Conceptual Design
CMPSC 24 - Problem Solving With Computers II (data structures)

name: UC San Diego
position: Double Major in Data Science and Business Economics
description: Transferred to UC San Diego in Fall 2023 to pursue a major in Data Science and added a double major in business economics in Fall 2024.
favoriteCourses: CSE 150A - Theoretical Foundations of Machine Learning

name: UC San Diego Systems Energy and Efficiency Lab CyberLab
description: Assisted in research at the Systems Energy Efficiency Lab (SEEL) CyberLab in Winter 2024, where we used machine learning to classify various cyberattacks using models from scikit-learn and TensorFlow, and datasets found online including X-IIoT and MQTT. Also learned about new (to me) ML methods like adversarial attacks and transfer learning.

name: Sidco Custom Upholstery
description: Created the company logo and designs for engraving in Corel. My favorite project was working on their Faverro brand slipcovers for various Porsche and Ferrari models. Created files from cardboard mockups to be fabricated in the laser cutter, allowing for large-scale production of custom seat protectors that have an OEM look and feel.

name: California Mobility Works
description: Learned to MIG weld and assisted in fabricating their Sagitta drivable mockup based on a Chevrolet Bolt platform. I also created a Solidworks model of the production prototype before the end of my internship.

name: Oxford Instruments Asylum Research
position: Machine Learning Research and Development Intern
description: Summer 2023 - Used Python remote procedure calls to autonomously scan Created a 2D convolutional neural network (CNN) to classify scan behaviors in atomic force microscopy (AFM). 2023-2024 school year - Developed an unsupervised clustering model of AFM video frames using a VGG-16 based image encoder. Summer 2024 - Adapted CNN model to be 1D and classify line segments, deployed model using aespm to incorporate classifications in a PID-style feedback loop for AFM scan parameter adjustments.
